title: Bradtl Lua
author: Bradtl Lua
content: I'm a new user on 1xbit... It was amusing that they have 45 deposit methods, which is really decent for users flexibilityBut sadly, there's 0 withdrawal option[img]https://imgur.com/a/2CXSC4UStay away from the site if you are a new user like me.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: I can not recommend anyone to use 1xbit because the gambling site do not have good reputation history on this forum, I have noticed newbies to on this forum that have just registered, complaining about 1xbit, it is a betting site I can not advice anyone to use. But let us get this clear, were you scam? I mean did you deposit money into the gambling site and you are not able to withdraw? Or you are just saying that you do not see the withdrawal?

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: If the image was from another site, I could think of legitimate reasons for that message to appear. For example that the wagering requirements have not been reached and that is why it does not allow you to withdraw, although the normal thing would be that the withdrawal option is there, and that when withdrawing you get the message that you cannot withdraw because the wagering requirements have not been reached. But being 1xBit, or 1xCrap, as I like to call them, I am not surprised. In the forum we have done what we could, as Eternad says, what makes me feel bad is that constantly new people fall into the trap.

comments.author: JollyGood
comments.body: That is why they have those terms and conditions in the place. It allows them and other online gaming/betting websites to simply invoke their ToS whenever they like in order to scam any user they want. In most cases they do not even feel obliged to show evidence of wrongdoing and it would not matter to them what evidence was sent by victims because it would be dismissed as the intention was/is to scam.1xbit does have longevity but eventually it will fade away in to obscurity. comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: aioc on July 08, 2022, 08:29:30 AMthe standard should be casinos should record and make public their number of winners and their biggest winners and biggest cash out because that's one big way to establish their reputation.Legally they are not liable for an open audit. When it's a Crypto gambling site then 100% they are taking the opportunity to keep everything behind open place. However if a casino wants then they can make their users betting history and other reports public, not showing the full username but hiding out the some characters. It sounds very transparent but if a casino have bad intention in mind they still can change the data to create a fake reputation.But it does not make sense that when a casino is in profit then why will they think of not paying their users. An unsatisfied customer can spread the bad experience to 10, from 10 it become 100. Eventually casino is losing their clients. Considering the reputation 1xbit has now, I have no idea why even they consider the forum for their advertising place?
